meanings.definition: To award a medal to someone.
meanings.sent1: The coach medalled the top player for their outstanding performance.
meanings.sent2: She medalled the winner of the race with a shiny gold medal.
meanings.sent3: The cat medalled the dog with a pretend medal for being the best napper.
meanings.sent4: The sun medalled the sky with golden rays at sunset.
meanings.sent5: The teacher medalled the student with a star sticker for excellent homework completion.

meanings.definition: To have won a medal in a competition.
meanings.sent1: He medalled in the swimming competition by winning first place.
meanings.sent2: They medalled in the dance-off and proudly wore their silver medal.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel medalled in the acorn gathering contest, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her smile medalled in brightness, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The tree medalled in height, towering over the rest of the forest.
